file.title: Portal demo
file.description: Try the Pentaho Portal Demo which includes all the samples available here and some additional dashboard ones

file.name: admin
file.title: Admin Services
file.description: Links for updating the system settings and web service examples

file.title: Permissions
file.description: This page allows you to set execute and overwrite permissions for content for users and roles

file.title: Scheduler Admin
file.description: This page allows you to enable disable etc the scheduler

file.title: Schedule Cleaning of Content Repository
file.description: Schedules the clean content repository action to run daily
file.author: William E. Seyler

file.title: Clean Repository
file.description: Removes files from the content repository that are more than 180 days old.
file.author: William E. Seyler

file.title: Subscription Admin
file.description: This page allows you to administer subscription content and schedules

file.name: Content
file.title: Content Repository Admin
file.description: Tools for the content Repository

repository.title: Pentaho Solution Browser
repository.description: Below lists collections of logically grouped Pentaho folders and documents called Solutions. By default, the "Sample" Solution is installed and contains working examples demonstrating the functionality of the platform. Once a Solution is chosen, use the file browser to locate and launch a document. To learn more about how to modify the examples or build a Solution, read the 'Creating Pentaho Solutions' document available at wiki.pentaho.org.

file.name: samples
file.title: Samples
file.description: A collection of examples showing features that are ready for use in the Pentaho BI Platform

file.name: services
file.title: Web Service Example
file.description: This action runs an example web service and returns a SOAP response

file.description: query rule test

file.title: Web Service Example
file.description: This action runs an example web service and returns a SOAP response

file.title: JFreeReport HTML Example
file.description: This is an example of an HTML report produced by JFreeReport. <p/> It shows the actual headcount cost, budgeted headcount cost, and variance for every position, department and region <p/> It demostrates using colors and styles for headers and groupings. It also shows sub-totals.
file.author: James Dixon

file.title: JFreeReport HTML Example
file.description: This is an example of an HTML report produced by JFreeReport. <p/> It shows the actual headcount cost, budgeted headcount cost, and variance for every position, department and region <p/> It demostrates using colors and styles for headers and groupings. It also shows sub-totals.
file.author: James Dixon

file.name: datasources
file.title: 6. DataSource Examples
file.description: Examples of data sets being returned from different OLAP and RDBMS data sources.

file.title: HQL Query using Hibernate
file.description: This rule uses the Hibernate Query Language (HQL) to return data for ContentItems. If no data is returned, then there is no data in hibernate for ContentItem.
file.author: Michael D'Amour

file.title: MDX Query of an OLAP Datasource
file.description:
This rule uses an MDX multidimensional query to return Actual and Budget for all Regions.

The data source is a Mondrian OLAP cube.
file.author: William Seyler

file.title: XQuery Query of an XML Datasource
file.description:
This rule uses an XML query to return a List of Books.

The data source is an XML Document.
file.author: William Seyler

file.title: SQL Query of Managers for Departments
file.description:
This rule uses a SQL database query to determine the manager for each region.

See the Quick Start Guide for how to customize this data.
file.author: James Dixon

file.name: svg
file.title: SVG Examples
file.description: Examples of using SVG to display data graphically

file.title: European Map
file.description: example of using an SVG template and a datasource to create a graphical representation of data. <p/>To see this you need to use Firefox 1.5, Opera 8, or the Adobe SVG viewer plug-in for Microsoft IE.
file.author: James Dixon

file.title: Dashboards
file.description: This uses Pentaho UI to build an interactive dashboard with a JSP page. The 'Dashboard Building Guide' explains the workings of this dashboard in detail.

file.description: This is an example of an HTML report produced by JFreeReport. <p/>It shows the actual headcount cost, budgeted headcount cost, and variance for every position in the specified department and region

file.name: rules
file.title: 3. Business Rules Examples
file.description:
Examples of business rules using scripting and database tables.
Rules are used as part of business intelligence process, but here you can run them individually

This rule is used in the Bursting Examples. See the Quick Start Guide for how to customize this data.

file.name: printing
file.title: 4. Printing Examples
file.description: Examples of content sent to printers. Content -> Printer. Got it?

file.title: Send Report to Printer
file.description:
This is an example of a report sent to a printer.

You will be asked to selected a printer to send the report to.

The list of printers will be the printers that the server has access to. If you are running the demo server on your local machine then you will see the list of printers for your machine.
file.author: Marc Batchelor

file.name: reporting
file.title: 2. Reporting Examples
file.description: Examples of HTML and PDF reports

file.title: Parameter Page Customization Example
file.description: This shows an example of a custom parameter page using an XSL template
file.author: Angelo Rodriguez

file.title: JFreeReport HTML Example
file.description: This is an example of an HTML report produced by JFreeReport. <p/> It shows the actual headcount cost, budgeted headcount cost, and variance for every position, department and region<p/> It demostrates using colors and styles for headers and groupings. It also shows sub-totals.
file.author: Angelo Rodriguez

file.title: Parameter Page Customization Example
file.description: This shows an example of a custom parameter page based on an HTML template
file.author: Angelo Rodriguez

file.title: OLAP Crosstab Report
file.description: A cross tab report that shows actual and budget data for every department across every region. The report queries a Mondrian OLAP server and uses JFreeReport to generate the page
file.author: William Seyler

file.title: JFreeReport with Pie Charts
file.description: Generates a PDF containing a Pie Chart based on a different SQL query than the report itself. The pie chart is created using the ChartComponent and is passed to JFreeReport as a parameter.
file.author: Michael D'Amour

file.title: JFree XQuery Report
file.description: Runs a JFreeReport against data stored in an XML document. The data is retrieved using an XQueryLookupRule.
file.author: Michael D'Amour

file.title: OLAP Crosstab Spreadsheet
file.description: A spreadsheet that shows actual and budget data for every department across every region. The report queries a Mondrian OLAP server and uses JFreeReport to generate the XLS file.
file.author: William Seyler

file.title: Subreport Example
file.description: This shows an example of a subreport in JFreeReport
file.author: Will Gorman

file.title: JFreeReport with Bar Chart
file.description: Runs a JFreeReport against data stored in an XML document and produces a Bar Chart using JFreeChart.
file.author: Michael D'Amour

file.name: dynamic-reports
file.title: Dynamic Reporting
file.description: Dynamic Reporting Examples

file.title: Programmatic Quadrant Report with Group Level Bar Charts
file.description: This action sequence executes a SQL query and then programmatically builds a ReportSpec object model which is used to generate a JFreeReport definition with a Bar Chart for each group run. The report definition is passed to JFreeReport and a formatted report is generated.
file.author: Michael D'Amour

file.title: Programmatic Quadrant Report
file.description: This action sequence executes a SQL query and then programmatically builds a ReportSpec object model which is used to generate a JFreeReport definition. The report definition is passed to JFreeReport and a formatted report is generated.
file.author: Michael D'Amour

file.title: Programmatic Quadrant Report with Pie Chart
file.description: This action sequence executes a SQL query and then programmatically builds a ReportSpec object model which is used to generate a JFreeReport definition with a Pie Chart. The report definition is passed to JFreeReport and a formatted report is generated.
file.author: Michael D'Amour

file.title: Fully Dynamic Quadrant Report
file.description: This action sequence executes a SQL query and then dynamically builds a ReportSpec object model which is used to generate a JFreeReport definition. The report definition is passed to JFreeReport and a formatted report is generated.
file.author: Michael D'Amour

file.title: Fully Dynamic Quadrant Report with Bar Chart
file.description: This action sequence executes a SQL query and then dynamically builds a ReportSpec object model which is used to generate a JFreeReport definition with a Chart. The report definition is passed to JFreeReport and a formatted report is generated.
file.author: Michael D'Amour

file.name: secure
file.title: 8. Secure Filters Examples (Portal only)
file.description: Examples of using session based filters and queries to determine the selections that users may pick based on their user id<p/><FONT color="red">These examples require a user id and only show data when logged in.</FONT>

file.title: Secure Session and Global Filters
file.description: This is an example of using a global filter and a session filter. <p/>The global filter is DEPARTMENT_LIST which provides values for the DEPARTMENT parameter. DEPARTMENT_LIST is generated by doing an SQL 'select distinct' on the departments column. Being a global filter, the query is executed only once and available to all users. <p/>The session filter REGION_FILTER is generated by a rule that is executed for each user that logs in. The values are stored in the user's session and is available as long as the user remains logged in.
file.author: Doug Moran

file.title: Secure Parameter Page Portlet Example For Portlet
file.description: This shows an example of a secure parameter page embedded as a portlet
file.author: Doug Moran

file.title: Two filter sets, secure and hard coded
file.description: This is an example of a report that requires 2 parameters; Region and Department.<p/>The Region selections are defined by a business rule executed during login and saved in the user's session.<p/>The Department values are hard coded in the Action Sequence document.
file.author: Doug Moran

file.title: Department list for global parameters
file.description: Does a SQL query for the list of departments and saves the list into the global parameter provider
file.author: Doug Moran

file.title: Secured PDF Example
file.description:
This is an example of a secure parameterized PDF report.

Valid entries are defined by a business rule executed during login and saved in the user's session.

If you are logged in as 'Suzy', you will be prompted to select a region filtered for her - 'Eastern', 'Western' and 'Southern'. Log in as 'Admin' who only has permission for 'Central' and you will not be prompted
file.author: Doug Moran

file.name: bursting
file.title: 5. Bursting Examples
file.description:
Bursting allows you to break a large task, like delivering reports to department managers, into a simple process that is repeated for each individual case.
The rules that determine the cases, and the processes for creating the content and delivering it can be customized to meet the requirements.

file.title: Workflow to generate and email a report
file.author: Doug Moran

file.title: 4. The report used in bursting examples
file.description: Parameterized PDF report produced by JFreeReport for bursting example. Requires a region, valid entries are 'Eastern', 'Western', 'Southern' and 'Central'
file.author: Doug Moran

file.title: 1. Setup
file.description: Edit the database table that stores the destination email addresses for each region in the sample data.<p/>This data is queried during the bursting examples and used to deliver custom reports.

file.title: 2. Burst Using Action Sequence Document
file.description:
This sample executes a burst that is defined in a single Action Sequence XML document.

Execute an SQL rule to get the list of managers and regions

Generate the regional report for each manager using JFreeReport

Deliver the report to the manager in Excel format as an email attachment
file.author: Doug Moran

file.title: 5. Scheduled Bursting
file.description:
This creates a scheduled job for triggering example 2 above.

The burst is triggered 3 times, two minutes apart

After starting this example click here to view the Scheduler Admin page
file.author: Doug Moran

file.title: Email used in bursting examples
file.description: Sends an email and attachment
file.author: Doug Moran

file.title: 3. Burst Using Workflow
file.description:
This sample executes a burst that is defined in a workflow

Execute an SQL rule to get the list of managers and regions

Generate the regional report for each manager using JFreeReport

Deliver the report to the manager in PDF format as an email attachment
file.author: Doug Moran

file.name: reporting
file.title: Reporting Examples
file.description: Examples of HTML and PDF reports

file.title: Eclipse BIRT HTML Example
file.description: This is an example of an HTML report produced by Eclipse BIRT.<p/>It shows the actual headcount cost, budgeted headcount cost, and variance for every position, department and region<p/>It demostrates using colors and styles for headers and groupings. It also shows sub-totals.
file.author: James Dixon

file.title: Eclipse BIRT HTML Example
file.description: This is an example of an HTML report produced by Eclipse BIRt. <p/> It shows the actual headcount cost, budgeted headcount cost, and variance for every position, department and region <p/> It demostrates using colors and styles for headers and groupings. It also shows sub-totals.
file.author: James Dixon

file.title: Custom Parameter Page Test
file.description: This shows an example of a custom parameter page
file.author: James Dixon

file.title: JFreeReport Demo Example
file.description: This is an example of using JFreeReport to execute their own demos in the demo jar file. This demonstrates the use of jar resources, and arbitrary tablemodel objects.
file.author: Marc Batchelor

file.title: JasperReports HTML Example
file.description: This is an example of an HTML report produced by JasperReports.<p/>It shows the actual headcount cost, budgeted headcount cost, and variance for every position, department and region<p/>It demostrates using colors and styles for headers and groupings. It also shows sub-totals.
file.author: James Dixon and Barry Klawans

file.title: JFreeReport HTML Example
file.description: This is an example of an HTML report produced by JFreeReport. <p/> It shows the actual headcount cost, budgeted headcount cost, and variance for every position, department and region <p/> It demostrates using colors and styles for headers and groupings. It also shows sub-totals.

file.title: Eclipse BIRT Parameterized PDF Example
file.description:
This is an example of a parameterized PDF report produced by Eclipse BIRT.

You will be first prompted for a region, valid entries are 'Eastern', 'Western', 'Southern' and 'Central'

A PDf containing a chart and a data table for the selected region will be generated and displayed (Adobe Acrobat plug-in required)
file.author: James Dixon

file.title: JFreeReport HTML Example
file.description: This is an example of an HTML report produced by JFreeReport. <p/> It shows the actual headcount cost, budgeted headcount cost, and variance for every position, department and region <p/> It demostrates using colors and styles for headers and groupings. It also shows sub-totals.
file.author: Marc Batchelor

file.title: Reporting Parameter Test
file.description: Javascript rule test
file.author: James Dixon

file.title: OLAP Crosstab Report
file.description: A cross tab report that shows actual and budget data for every department across every region. The report queries a Mondrian OLAP server and uses JFreeReport to generate the page
file.author: William Seyler

file.title: Mass CRON Scheduler
file.description: Creates a set of crons based on two file inputs. One file is a list of action sequences to schedule. The other is a list of crons to schedule those action sequences against.
